error.signature: Error: Output refers to sensitive values: output value depends on sensitive attributes
error.regex: (Output .+ sensitive values|output .+ depends on sensitive|sensitive value .+ not allowed in output|nonsensitive\(\) function)

verdict.summary: An output value references a sensitive attribute without being marked sensitive itself.

dead_ends.action: Use nonsensitive() on actually sensitive values to bypass the check
dead_ends.why_fails: nonsensitive() removes protection from genuinely sensitive data like passwords and keys, exposing them in plan output

dead_ends.action: Remove the sensitive flag from the source variable or resource attribute
dead_ends.why_fails: The upstream provider marks attributes as sensitive for security reasons; this cannot be changed

workarounds.action: Mark the output as sensitive = true
workarounds.how: Add sensitive = true to the output block: output "name" { value = EXPR; sensitive = true }

workarounds.action: Use nonsensitive() only when the value is not actually sensitive (e.g., resource ID derived from sensitive input)
workarounds.how: output "id" { value = nonsensitive(resource.example.id) } when the ID itself is not a secret

leads_to.condition: After marking output sensitive, consumers may need to handle sensitive values

preceded_by.condition: Output reference changes introduce sensitive value propagation

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Output reference error is about invalid output references; sensitive value output is specifically about sensitive data exposure in outputs
